subject: Psychology
title: The Bystander Effect
description: A fast breakdown of The Bystander Effect for builders.

hook.text: Kitty Genovese was attacked while dozens watched from their windows. Nobody called for help. Why?

buildup.text: Darley and LatanÃ© proposed the bystander effect: the more witnesses, the less likely any one person will help.

discovery.text: Diffusion of responsibility is the key: 'Someone else will call.' Everyone thinks that, so nobody calls.

twist.text: When you're the only witness, helping rates soar. Remove the crowd and the hero emerges.

climax.text: Knowing the effect is the antidote. Point to one person: 'You in the red shirt, call 911.' Responsibility returns.

punchline.text: In a crowd, everyone waits for someone else to act.

quiz.question: What causes the bystander effect?
options: Diffusion of responsibility among multiple witnesses
People being naturally cruel and indifferent
Witnesses always wanting to help but being physically unable
